intro: Gomphocarpus involucratus, commonly known as the yellow moonflower, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family and is characterized by its showy, yellow flowers that open at night. The plant has a distinctive capsule fruit that splits open to release its seeds. Its leaves are opposite and often covered in fine hairs. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in coastal and sandy habitats.
